...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS
EVENING...

HAZARDOUS WEATHER...

 * SNOW WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE AREA EARLY THIS MORNING. A QUICK INCH
   OR TWO OF SNOW ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED.

 * SNOW WILL CHANGE OVER TO SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN MID TO LATE MORNING.
   UP TO A QUARTER OF AN INCH OF ICE ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED.

 * FREEZING RAIN IS THEN EXPECTED TO CHANGE TO PLAIN RAIN OR 
   DRIZZLE SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 

 * RAIN WILL CHANGE BACK OVER TO SNOW LATE SATURDAY NIGHT.

IMPACTS...

 * ROADS WILL BECOME SLICK THIS MORNING...BEFORE IMPROVING SATURDAY
   AFTERNOON AS TEMPERATURES WARM ABOVE FREEZING.

 * SCATTERED POWER OUTAGES WILL BECOME POSSIBLE THIS MORNING.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

 * THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION REMINDS MOTORISTS 
   TO ADJUST SPEEDS BASED ON THE CONDITIONS... AND TO TAKE IT 
   SLOW IN ICE AND SNOW. 

 * WEATHER PREPAREDNESS INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE ON LINE AT 
   WWW.READY.GOV/WINTER AND HTTP://GO.USA.GOV/5OG.
